item.title: S. 231, Automatic Defibrillation in Adam's Memory Act
item.description: Cost estimate for the bill as ordered reported by the Senate Committee on Health, Education, Labor, and Pensions on April 2, 2003

item.text: For further action, see H.R. 389, which became Public Law 108-41 on 7/1/2003.

summary.text: Automatic Defibrillation in Adam's Memory Act - Amends the Public Health Service Act to authorize the use of certain grant funds to establish a national information clearinghouse that provides information to increase public access to defibrillation in schools.

(This measure has not been amended since it was introduced in the Senate on January 29, 2003. The summary of that version is repeated here.)

Automatic Defibrillation in Adam's Memory Act - Amends the Public Health Service Act to authorize the use of certain grant funds to establish a national information clearinghouse that provides information to increase public access to defibrillation in schools.

dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.
dublinCore.dc:contributor: Congressional Research Service, Library of Congress
dublinCore.dc:description: This file contains bill summaries and statuses for federal legislation. A bill summary describes the most significant provisions of a piece of legislation and details the effects the legislative text may have on current law and federal programs. Bill summaries are authored by the Congressional Research Service (CRS) of the Library of Congress. As stated in Public Law 91-510 (2 USC 166 (d)(6)), one of the duties of CRS is "to prepare summaries and digests of bills and resolutions of a public general nature introduced in the Senate or House of Representatives". For more information, refer to the User Guide that accompanies this file.
